SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.rmi

Class RMIClient

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.network.rmi.RMIClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualClient, Serializable, Remote
public class RMIClient extends UnicastRemoteObject implements VirtualClient
This class implements VirtualClient interface using rmi connection protocol.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    Description
    void
    closeOnNext()
    Since rmi connection cannot be effectively closed, this method stops the update thread, so that calls to rmi client have no effect on the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • RMIClient

      public RMIClient(int registryPort) throws RemoteException, NotBoundException
      Constructs a rmi client establishing connection on localhost.
      Parameters:
      registryPort - server port
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the object can't be exported or if the registry cannot be located
      NotBoundException - if virtual server name is not bound

    • RMIClient

      public RMIClient(String registryIP, int registryPort) throws RemoteException, NotBoundException
      Constructs a rmi client establishing connection on specified ip.
      Parameters:
      registryIP - server ip
      registryPort - server port
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the object can't be exported or if the registry cannot be located
      NotBoundException - if virtual server name is not bound

    • deckUpdate

      public void deckUpdate(char deck, String revealedId, int cardPosition) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: VirtualClient
      Notifies a change in the specified deck.

      A deck has three positions to model the three visible cards of a deck:
      0 - the top card;
      1 - the first revealed card;
      2 - the second revealed card.

      A revealed card is one of the previous, as once a card is drawn another one must be revealed.

      Specified by:
      deckUpdate in interface VirtualClient
      Parameters:
      deck - the changed deck identifier
      revealedId - the identifier of the revealed card
      cardPosition - the card which was changed (top = 0, first = 1, second = 2)
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs

    • setDeckState

      public void setDeckState(char deck, String topId, String firstId, String secondId) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: VirtualClient
      Notifies about the current state of the deck.

      Since all three of the cards are given it means that at least all of the position of the deck have a drawable card.
      It doesn't give any information about the status of the rest of the deck.

      Specified by:
      setDeckState in interface VirtualClient
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck identifier
      topId - the top card currently visible on the deck
      firstId - the first revealed card of the deck
      secondId - the second revealed card of the deck
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs

    • setDeckState

      public void setDeckState(char deck, String revealedId, int cardPosition) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: VirtualClient
      Notifies about the current state of the deck.

      This displayMessage can be triggered iff in the deck remained just one card.
      The card can be only one of the revealed ones, due to the decks' rule that obliges to reveal a card after a revealed card has been drawn. This implies that cardPosition will only accept values 1 or 2.

      Specified by:
      setDeckState in interface VirtualClient
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck identifier
      revealedId - the only revealed card remained in the deck
      cardPosition - the revealed card position
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs

    • setDeckState

      public void setDeckState(char deck, String firstCardId, String secondCardId) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: VirtualClient
      Notifies about the current state of the identified deck.

      This displayMessage can be triggered iff the deck's face-down card pile is empty thus displaying only the two revealed cards.

      Specified by:
      setDeckState in interface VirtualClient
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck identifier
      firstCardId - the first card identifier
      secondCardId - the second card identifier
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error is detected

    • setPlayAreaState

      public void setPlayAreaState(String nickname, List<CardPosition> cardPositions, Map<GameResource,Integer> visibleResources, List<SerializableCorner> freeSerializableCorners) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: VirtualClient
      Notifies about the player's play area status.
      Specified by:
      setPlayAreaState in interface VirtualClient
      Parameters:
      nickname - the play area owner's id
      cardPositions - a list/set of card positions representing the play area (can be empty)
      visibleResources - a map of the current visible resources on the player's play area (can be empty)
      freeSerializableCorners - a representation of the free corners in the player's play area (can be empty)
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs

    • updatePlaceCard

      public void updatePlaceCard(String nickname, String placedCardId, int row, int col, boolean placeOnFront) throws RemoteException
      Description copied from interface: VirtualClient
      Notifies about card's placement.

      The parameter (0,0) is strictly associated to the starting card.
      Therefore if this parameter is read when a non-starting card is passed that an error must occur.

      Specified by:
      updatePlaceCard in interface VirtualClient
      Parameters:
      nickname - the play area owner's identifier
      placedCardId - the placed card's identifier
      row - the row in which the card was placed
      col - the column in which the card was placed
      placeOnFront - the side on which to place the card
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a connection error occurs

      Returns:

    • closeOnNext

      public void closeOnNext()
      Since rmi connection cannot be effectively closed, this method stops the update thread, so that calls to rmi client have no effect on the application.
